‘Everything that happens is from now on’


We are The Bittersweet and we’ve got issues. Major issues.

Handcuffed by our own musical limitations we have called it a day twice now, first time on a beach in the South of Spain, second time in the tiny village of Ripponden, Yorkshire.
We put ourselves under so much pressure, we criticise and turn on everything we ever do.
We compare ourselves to………. well already that sentence contains the problem.
I guess it’s human nature to never feel worthy or good enough, so you let the ever-eager hand of fear lead you to where you think it’s safe, hidden from view.
All we have ever wanted to achieve with our music is to reach people in a way that the music we have loved has shaped and soundtracked our lives.
But the world does not always give you what you want, and the decision you face is ‘do you give up?’,
Or, do you try and do the best with what you have, to keep praying and hope that someday you arrive at a place that up until now has existed only inside your head.
Maybe the answer is in accepting that you might not change the world but you might make it slightly better rather than worse. And maybe that would be enough to feel like there was a point to your existence.
To quote the band that we look up to most (though we sound nothing like) Bon Iver -

‘Everything that happens is from now on’

This is the sentiment that the Bittersweet are taking into the future as we give everything to try and make music that has some meaning in an oversaturated world.
